summary: This document is a daily lieutenant's log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, NY, covering three shifts on July 10, 2019. It details routine operations, inmate counts, and specific entries regarding inmate Jeffrey Epstein, who was on psychological observation. The log records his removal from psychological observation during the day shift.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Listed as inmate #76318-054, initially on psychological observation with an inmate companion, and was removed from psychological observation at 12:15 PM on July 10, 2019.

persons.name: Siders
persons.context: Inmate #82219-083 who was released from custody on time served after a court release at 6:49 PM on July 10, 2019.

events.title: Epstein removed from psychological observation
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) was removed from psychological observation status at 12:15 PM.

events.title: Inmate fight and administrative detention
events.description: Two inmates (#73822-053 and #76315-054) were escorted from their unit to the Special Housing Unit (ZA) for fighting at 6:23 PM and subsequently placed in Administrative Detention.

events.title: Court release of inmate Siders
events.description: Inmate Siders (#82219-083) was released from custody on time served following a court release at 6:49 PM.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein (inmate #76318-054) was on psychological observation with an inmate companion at the start of the log on July 10, 2019.
Epstein was removed from psychological observation at 12:15 PM on July 10, 2019.
The log indicates routine facility operations were ongoing, with counts, equipment checks, and inmate movements.
Several other inmates were involved in incidents, including a fight leading to administrative detention and a court-ordered release.
The document is a standard correctional facility administrative log from the day, showing no extraordinary events related to Epstein's custody at that specific time.
